detaileddescription.para: Unware which model number we're going to use (HW/SW) but 16 bytes should be enough
Same as BSE ID which is 13 bytes
The maximum length occupied by a timezone from the IANA database is 32. The length is set to 40 just to accommodate few more characters, if the database is updated in future.
As per ISO 8061 Expected not exceed 9 bytes

memberdef.name: Lwm2m_deviceBindingAttributes
memberdef.initializer: = { { LWM2M_STRING_NULL, LWM2M_ONE_U32 }, { LWM2M_STRING_CAPITAL_U, LWM2M_ONE_U32 }, { LWM2M_STRING_CAPITAL_S, LWM2M_ONE_U32 }, { LWM2M_STRING_CAPITAL_US, LWM2M_TWO_U32 }, { LWM2M_STRING_NULL, LWM2M_ONE_U32 }, { LWM2M_STRING_CAPITAL_UQ, LWM2M_TWO_U32 }, { LWM2M_STRING_CAPITAL_SQ, LWM2M_TWO_U32 }, { LWM2M_STRING_CAPITAL_UQS, LWM2M_THREE_U32 }, }

briefdescription.para: Structure for device binding attributes. Refer enum Lwm2m_Binding_E under Serval_Lwm2m.h to check the mapped stings.

memberdef.name: LWM2MObjectDeviceResources
memberdef.initializer: = { { 0, LWM2M_STRING_RO((char *) DeviceManufacturer) }, { 1, LWM2M_STRING_RO((char *) DeviceModelNumber) }, { 2, LWM2M_DYNAMIC(serialNumber_RO) | LWM2M_READ_ONLY }, { 3, LWM2M_DYNAMIC(firmwareVersionNumber_RO) | LWM2M_READ_ONLY }, { 4, LWM2M_FUNCTION(deviceRebootFunc) }, { 5, LWM2M_FUNCTION(factoryResetFunc) }, { 6, LWM2M_DYNAMIC(availablePowerSourcesfunc) | LWM2M_READ_ONLY }, { 7, LWM2M_DYNAMIC(powerSourceVoltageFunc) | LWM2M_READ_ONLY }, { 9, LWM2M_DYNAMIC(batteryLevelFunc) | LWM2M_READ_ONLY }, { 11, LWM2M_DYNAMIC_ARRAY(errorCodeFunc) | LWM2M_READ_ONLY }, { 12, LWM2M_FUNCTION(resetErrorCodeFunc) }, { 13, LWM2M_DYNAMIC(getCurrentTime) }, { 14, LWM2M_DYNAMIC(lwm2mDeviceUtcOffset) }, { 15, LWM2M_DYNAMIC(getTimeZone) }, { 16, LWM2M_DYNAMIC(lwm2mDeviceGetBinding) | LWM2M_READ_ONLY }, { 20, LWM2M_DYNAMIC(batteryStatusFunc) | LWM2M_READ_ONLY }, }

briefdescription.para: This function is used to update the Available Power Sources Resource value into the LWM2M Server*.
This function is used to update the batteryLevel Resource value into the LWM2M Server*.
This function is used to update the battery Status Resource value into the LWM2M Server*.
Convert Decimal/Hex value to String Format to display Version Information.

parameterdescription.para: Number which needs to be convert into string to display in Decimal instead of HEX values.
*str pointer to Store/write the Version number in String Format.

briefdescription.para: This function is to convert the integer data into a string data.

detaileddescription.para:
appVersion
32 bit value containing the FOTA version information
xdkVersion
32 bit value containing the XDK SW version information
in/out]
str pointer to the parsed version string
Returns
index where the application version starts
1. FOTA capable device only has the Valid application firmware version in that case output format will be example:v3.0.1-0.0.1( XDK Version + Application version)
For Non- FOTA capable device version number will be v3.0.1-xx.xx.xx( XDK Version-xx.xx.xx)
Also note that the XDK version number is represented in Decimal format (i.e if XDK version is 3.0.1). the following macros maintain to represent the XDK SW release version #define XDKVERSION_MAJOR 3 #define XDKVERSION_MINOR 0 #define XDKVERSION_PATCH 1
Also note that the Application version number is represented in Decimal format. example: if user modifies the application version value macros under application.mk as follows MAJOR_SW_NO ?= 0xFF MINOR_SW_NO ?= 0xFF PATCH_SW_NO ?= 0xFF so, the appVersion will be represented as 255.255.255

detaileddescription.para: The description is in the configuration header

briefdescription.para: Enable LWM2M object instance. Start reporting values. Function is thread safe, it schedules a job for serval. Execution may therefore be deferred.
Initialize LWM2M object instance. Must be called before any other function call.
notify that the device time has changed. Will send a notification to observers. Function is thread safe, it schedules a job for serval. Execution may therefore be deferred.
